xxl.core.util.metaData
Class CompositeMetaData<I,M>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.util.metaData.CompositeMetaData<I,M>
Type Parameters:
I - the type of the identifiers.
M - the type of the metadata fragments.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, Iterable<Map.Entry<I,M>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
TransparentCompositeMetaData
public class CompositeMetaData<I,M>
extends Object
implements Iterable<Map.Entry<I,M>>, Cloneable

A composite metadata provides a generic metadata object that can be used to merge different metadata object, so called metadata fragments, to a single one that can be handled by the getMetaData method of the interface MetaDataProvider. The different metadata fragments describing an object can easily be plugged together to a composite metadata. In order to retrieve the separate metadata fragments from the composite metadata, they must be associated to unique identifiers, that are published to composite metadata when a new metadata fragment is plugged in. MetaDataException are used to indicate an inappropriate use of identifiers, i.e., when adding a new metadata fragment associated with an identifier that is already published to the composite metadata or removing a metadata fragment associated with an identifier that is unknown.

Note: When trying to plug in a composite metadata to another composite metadata using the addAll method, the metadata fragments of the first composite metadata will be plugged in the second composite metadata associated with the identifiers used in the first composite metadata.

See Also:
MetaDataProvider.getMetaData(), MetaDataException

Field Summary
protected  java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock lock
          The reentrant read/write lock is used to synchronize the access of the internally used concurrent hash map.
protected  java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<I,M> metaDataMap
          A concurrent hash map that is internally used to store the metadata fragments this composite metadata is built up of.

          A reference to the write lock of the internally used reentrant read/write lock.

Method Detail

add

public void add(I identifier,
                M metaData)
         throws MetaDataException
Adds the given metadata fragment associated the specified identifier to this composite metadata. If the composite metadata already contains a metadata fragment for the specified identifier, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
identifier - the identifier with which the specified metadata fragment is to be associated.
metaData - the metadata fragment to be plugged to this composite metadata associated with the specified identifier.
Throws:
MetaDataException - if the composite metadata already contains a metadata fragment associated with the specified identifier.

addAll

public <J extends I> void addAll(CompositeMetaData<J,? extends M> compositeMetaData)
            throws MetaDataException
Adds the whole given composite metadata to this one by adding every metadata fragment of it. The metadata fragments of the given composite metadata are associated with their original identifiers. If the calling composite metadata already contains a metadata fragment for one of the given composite metadata's identifier, the remaining metadata fragments are added to it and afterwards an exception is thrown.

Type Parameters:
J - the type of the given composite metadata's identifiers.
Parameters:
compositeMetaData - the composite metadata whose metadata fragments should be plugged to the calling composite metadata associated with their original identifier.
Throws:
MetaDataException - if the composite metadata already contains a metadata fragment associated with one of the given composite matedata's identifiers.

put

public M put(I identifier,
             M metaData)
Puts the given metadata fragment associated the specified identifier into this composite metadata and returns the metadata fragment previously associated with the specified identifier by the composite metadata or null if there is no such metadata fragment.

Parameters:
identifier - the identifier with which the specified metadata fragment is to be associated.
metaData - the metadata fragment to be plugged to this composite metadata associated with the specified identifier.
Returns:
the metadata fragment previously associated with the specified identifier by this composite metadata or null if there is no such metadata fragment.

putAll

public <J extends I> Iterator<Map.Entry<J,M>> putAll(CompositeMetaData<J,? extends M> compositeMetaData)
Puts the whole given composite metadata into this one by putting every metadata fragment of it. The metadata fragments of the given composite metadata are associated with their original identifiers. This method returns an iteration over the metadata fragments previously associated with the given composite metadata's identifiers by the calling composite metadata. If an identifier was not associated with a metadata fragment within the calling composite metadata the corresponding position of the returned iteration will be null.

Type Parameters:
J - the type of the given composite metadata's identifiers.
Parameters:
compositeMetaData - the composite metadata whose metadata fragments should be plugged to the calling composite metadata associated with their original identifier.
Returns:
an iteration over the metadata fragments previously associated with the given composite metadata's identifiers by the calling composite metadata. If an identifier was not associated with a metadata fragment within the calling composite metadata the corresponding position of the returned iteration will be null.

replace

public M replace(I identifier,
                 M metaData)
          throws MetaDataException
Replaces the given metadata fragment associated the specified identifier in this composite metadata and returns the metadata fragment previously associated with the specified identifier by the composite metadata. If the composite metadata does not contain a metadata fragment for the specified identifier, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
identifier - the identifier with which the specified metadata fragment is to be associated.
metaData - the metadata fragment to be plugged to this composite metadata associated with the specified identifier.
Returns:
the metadata fragment previously associated with the specified identifier by this composite metadata.
Throws:
MetaDataException - if the composite metadata does not contain a metadata fragment associated with the specified identifier.

replaceAll

public <J extends I> Iterator<Map.Entry<J,M>> replaceAll(CompositeMetaData<J,? extends M> compositeMetaData)
                                              throws MetaDataException
Replaces the whole given composite metadata in this one by replacing every metadata fragment of it. The metadata fragments of the given composite metadata are associated with their original identifiers. This method returns an iteration over the metadata fragments previously associated with the given composite metadata's identifiers by the calling composite metadata. If the calling composite metadata does not contain a metadata fragment for every identifier of the given composite metadata, the remaining metadata fragments are replaced and afterwards an exception is thrown.

Type Parameters:
J - the type of the given composite metadata's identifiers.
Parameters:
compositeMetaData - the composite metadata whose metadata fragments should be plugged to the calling composite metadata associated with their original identifier.
Returns:
an iteration over the metadata fragments previously associated with the given composite metadata's identifiers by the calling composite metadata.
Throws:
MetaDataException - if the composite metadata does not contain a metadata fragment for every identifier of the given composite metadata.

contains

public boolean contains(I identifier)
Returns true if this composite metadata contains a metadata fragment for the specified identifier.

Parameters:
identifier - the identifier whose presence in this composite metadata is to be tested.
Returns:
true if this composite metadata contains a metadata fragment for the specified identifier.

get

public M get(I identifier)
      throws MetaDataException
Returns the metadata fragment the specified identifier is associated with by this composite metadata. A return value of null indicates that null is explicitly associated with the given identifier by the composite metadata. If the composite metadata does not contain a metadata fragment for the specified identifier, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
identifier - the identifier whose associated metadata fragment is to be returned.
Returns:
the metadata fragment that is associated with the given identifier by this composite metadata.
Throws:
MetaDataException - if the composite metadata does not contain a metadata fragment associated with the specified identifier.

remove

public M remove(I identifier)
         throws MetaDataException
Removes the metadata fragment for this identifer from this composite metadata. If the composite metadata does not contain a metadata fragment for the specified identifier, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
identifier - the identifier whose metadata fragment is to be removed from the composite metadata.
Returns:
the previous metadata fragment associated with specified identifier. A null return indicates that the composite metadata previously associated null with the specified identifier.
Throws:
MetaDataException - if the composite metadata does not contain a metadata fragment associated with the specified identifier.

public int size()
Returns the number of metadata fragment this composite metadata is built up of.

Returns:
the number of metadata fragments this composite metadata is built up of.

identifiers

public Iterator<I> identifiers()
Returns an iteration over the identifiers the metadata fragments this composite metadata is built up of are associated with. The iteration is backed by the composite metadata, so changes performed on the iteration are reflected in the composite metadata.

Returns:
an iteration over the identifiers the metadata fragments this composite metadata is built up of are associated with.

fragments

public Iterator<M> fragments()
Returns an iteration over the metadata fragments this composite metadata is built up of. The iteration is backed by the composite metadata, so changes performed on the iteration are reflected in the composite metadata.

Returns:
an iteration over the metadata fragments this composite metadata is built up of.

iterator

public Iterator<Map.Entry<I,M>> iterator()
Returns an iteration over the identifier/metadata fragment pairs this composite metadata is built up of. The iteration is backed by the composite metadata, so changes performed on the iteration are reflected in the composite metadata.

Specified by:
iterator in interface Iterable<Map.Entry<I,M>>
Returns:
an iteration over the identifier/metadata fragment pairs this composite metadata is built up of.

hashCode

public int hashCode()
Returns the hash code value for this composite metadata. The hash code of a composite metadata is defined to be the sum of the hash codes of each stored metadata fragment. This ensures that t1.equals(t2) implies that t1.hashCode()==t2.hashCode() for any two composite metadatas t1 and t2, as required by the general contract of Object.hashCode.

This implementation simply returns the hash code of the internally used hash map.

Overrides:
hashCode in class Object
Returns:
the hash code value for this composite metadata.
See Also:
Object.hashCode(), equals(Object)

equals

public boolean equals(Object object)
Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this composite metadata.

The equals method implements an equivalence relation:

  • It is reflexive: for any reference value x, x.equals(x) should return true.
  • It is symmetric: for any reference values x and y, x.equals(y) should return true if and only if y.equals(x) returns true.
  • It is transitive: for any reference values x, y, and z, if x.equals(y) returns true and y.equals(z) returns true, then x.equals(z) should return true.
  • It is consistent: for any reference values x and y, multiple invocations of x.equals(y) consistently return true or consistently return false, provided no information used in equals comparisons on the object is modified.
  • For any non-null reference value x, x.equals(null) should return false.

The current equals method returns true if and only if the given object:

  • is this composite metadata or
  • is an instance of the type CompositeMetaData and the internally used hash maps of this and the specified object are equal.

Overrides:
equals in class Object
Parameters:
object - the reference object with which to compare.
Returns:
true if this object is the same as the specified object; false otherwise.
See Also:
hashCode()

clone

             throws CloneNotSupportedException

toString

public String toString()
Returns a string representation of the composite metadata. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read.

The toString method for this class simply returns the textually representation of its internally user hash map.

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
a string representation of the composite metadata.
